meanings.definition: Dust or fine particles in the air.
meanings.sent1: The stoor in the room made her sneeze.
meanings.sent2: After cleaning the attic, there was stoor everywhere.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy rolled in the stoor, leaving paw prints all over the house.
meanings.sent4: As the car sped off, a stoor of dust followed in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The sunbeams illuminated the stoor, creating a magical shimmer in the air.

meanings.definition: To make a place dusty or dirty.
meanings.sent1: Please don't stoor up the freshly cleaned room.
meanings.sent2: The kids managed to stoor the entire playground with sand.
meanings.sent3: He tried to stoor the evidence of his clumsiness before his mom saw.
meanings.sent4: The wind began to stoor the fallen leaves around the yard.
meanings.sent5: The workers had to stoor the old warehouse before renovating it.

meanings.definition: A cloud of dust or smoke.
meanings.sent1: The explosion created a massive stoor that covered the area.
meanings.sent2: The farmer watched as a stoor rose from the dirt road.
meanings.sent3: The magician disappeared in a stoor of smoke, leaving the audience amazed.
meanings.sent4: The old chimney released a stoor of soot into the sky.
meanings.sent5: The rally car kicked up a stoor of dust as it raced around the track.
